name: 4,5,6,7-tetrachloro-2-phenyl-1,3-benzodioxole
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-1978
Reason: 4,5,6,7-tetrachloro-2-phenyl-1,3-benzodioxole has a melting point that we will compare to benzene, which has a melting point of 5.5 °C. The basic unit for comparison is benzene, which has a melting point of 5.5 °C. The introduction of four chlorine atoms significantly increases the melting point due to strong electronegativity which leads to stronger intermolecular dipole-dipole interactions. Each chlorine is estimated to increase the melting point by approximately 10 degrees Celsius, giving a total increase of (10 degrees Celsius x 4 chlorines) = 40 degrees Celsius. Additionally, the phenyl group in the molecule also contributes to the melting point due to its ability to enhance π-π interactions and overall molecular rigidity. The phenyl group is estimated to add approximately +30 degrees Celsius due to its ability to enhance π-π interactions and overall molecular rigidity.
